rComments: There was unclarity/inconsistency surrounding grading criteria and assignment requirements; Swapna was always willing to help out via email which I appreciated. Her approach to this course involved a lot of self-reflection; this was also appreciated as it differed from standard history courses. Communication with the prof was key in doing well.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I'm finishing up my degree and I've never taken a course so confusing and emotionally draining in all my years at uOttawa. The assignments were either irrelevant or too difficult for a first year intro course imo (or both). It's a shame because her approach may deter students from taking more Indigenous studies courses in the future.

This class made me go insane and it's all because of this prof. She straight-up lied to us about the exam format, and I've never been more frustrated in my entire life. She constantly says one thing but then does another. I would recommend that you stray far away from Swapna's class.

The criteria for assignments changed every lecture. The syllabus was useless and was not followed at all. She says to participate but is rude/demeaning to anyone who talks. She's also not Indigenous, teaching an Indigenous studies course and acted like her word was the be-all and end-all. The exam was not based on class content. Avoid at all costs
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: She made me hate this course. I dreaded showing up every time. She would pick on students and belittle them in front of everyone and wasn't clear with her answers. She honestly raised more questions than answers when she responded to a student - and not the good kind either. Her lectures were dense and hard to pay attention to. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Swapna, in general, is a nice lady but as a teacher, she is not my favourite. The assignments were irrelevant, unnecessarily confusing and did not solidify the content for me. Some of the class discussions were also pretty wild, but that probably differs for every class. Take a different prof if you can.

Swapna is one of the worst teachers that I have had. Her assignments were irrelevant, convoluted, and extremely poorly outlined. She regularly gaslit students in the middle of lectures just to prove a point. She straight up lied to us about how she was marking an assignment. She essentially seemed intent on proving that we were all ignorant- AVOID
